components.description:
A brightly colored sari draped in different ways across platforms. Sometimes used to mean a dress in general.

This emoji is sometimes used playfully in English to stand in for the word 'sorry.'
components.title: Sari

title: Sari

version.description: Unicode 12.0 was released on March 5, 2019. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page. See Emoji 12.0 for the full 2019 emoji list. More about this update.

apple_vendor_description: The sari emoji on Apple devices is a beautiful representation of traditional Indian attire, depicted with flowing fabric and rich, jewel-toned colors that exhibit Apple's signature glossy 3D shading. Its elegant drape and subtle highlights create a sense of depth and luxury, reflecting Appleâ€™s meticulous attention to detail. This emoji evokes cultural appreciation, celebration, and elegance, adding a touch of sophisticated charm to any message.
